meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a page.
meanings.sent1: The paginal design of the website made it easy to navigate.
meanings.sent2: The paginal layout of the magazine was visually appealing.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her messy desk was paginal chaos.
meanings.sent4: The city streets, with their grid-like pattern, seemed paginal from above.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the paginal beauty of nature.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a leaf or page of a book.
meanings.sent1: The paginal illustration at the beginning of the chapter was stunning.
meanings.sent2: He carefully turned each paginal leaf of the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The librarian playfully called the torn page a paginal puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her memories unfolded like a paginal story in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The paginal scent of old books filled the library.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or pertaining to pages.
meanings.sent1: The paginal content of the report was well-organized.
meanings.sent2: She flipped through the paginal sections of the document.
meanings.sent3: The printer jammed, causing a paginal mishap in the middle of printing.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like paginal chapters in a never-ending book.
meanings.sent5: The paginal details in the manual were helpful for assembly.
